page.title: 05LITTLE MARCLE FARMING (3)
page.content: {Apples There are extensive orchards producing eating & cooking apples. There is no "pick your own". One fruit farm specialises in quality apples, some for export. Orchards are protected from wind by high hedges. Dwarfing rootstock is used to keep trees small. Fruit is thinned by hand early in the season to enhance quality. Apples are hand picked. Varieties include Crispin & Spartan for eating or cooking, Jonogold an excellent eater, Discovery an early eater, some russets, the popular Cox's Orange Pippin for keeping & eating & Bramley's Seedling a long keeping cooker. Specialised packaging is used. Some casual workers are employed seasonally.
